etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French satyre, or via Latin from Greek saturos

definitions: one of a class of lustful, drunken woodland gods. In Greek art they were represented as a man with a horse's ears and tail, but in Roman representations as a man with a goat's ears, tail, legs, and horns.
shortDefinitions: one of class of lustful, drunken woodland gods

definitions: a man who has strong sexual desires
shortDefinitions: man who has strong sexual desires

definitions: a satyrid butterfly with chiefly dark brown wings.

notes.text: Tribes Satyrini (including the Eurasian genus Satyrus) and Euptychiini (the American wood satyrs), subfamily Satyrinae, family Nymphalidae

shortDefinitions: satyrid butterfly with chiefly dark brown wings
